pageContext.claim: “The FBI failed to disclose the nature of the political hit job to the FISA court. They hid it, they deceived it and they lied.”
pageContext.analysis: The FBI disclosed, in a footnote in its FISA filings, that Christopher Steele's research was conducted on behalf of an opposing candidate. According to the inspector general: "The footnote stated that Steele was hired by an identified U.S. person (Glenn Simpson) to conduct research regarding "Candidate #l's" (Donald Trump) ties to Russia and that the FBI 'speculates' that this U.S. person was likely looking for information that could be used to discredit the Trump campaign." The FBI did not act with political bias when it applied for the surveillance warrant on Page, the IG found.
